posts.post_content: This was the first "no duh" permanent I thought of when I saw [Zedruu the Greathearted](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zedruu the Greathearted) spoiled.
posts.html:
This was the first "no duh" permanent I thought of when I saw Zedruu the Greathearted spoiled.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: lorendorky (6/19/2011 1:25:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Fenizrael and ICEFANG13: [Clock of Omens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clock of Omens) works perfectly with this, even if you have [Unwinding Clock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unwinding Clock) as well.  
  
Recall that the untap step happens before anything else. All you need to do is activate Clock of Omens during your opponents' upkeep steps, targeting Clock of Omens (it doesn't say you have to target a tapped artifact) and tapping Howling Mine and Clock of Omens to pay the cost. The clock untaps, the mine stays tapped, and you're good to go. If you're not playing Commander, note that you can do this with one Clock of Omens for any number of Howling Mines.
posts.html:
@Fenizrael and ICEFANG13: Clock of Omens works perfectly with this, even if you have Unwinding Clock as well.

Recall that the untap step happens before anything else. All you need to do is activate Clock of Omens during your opponents' upkeep steps, targeting Clock of Omens (it doesn't say you have to target a tapped artifact) and tapping Howling Mine and Clock of Omens to pay the cost. The clock untaps, the mine stays tapped, and you're good to go. If you're not playing Commander, note that you can do this with one Clock of Omens for any number of Howling Mines.

Posted By: bijart_dauth (6/17/2011 4:22:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ Fenizrael  
  
[Clock of Omens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clock of Omens) would be my choice, but probably isn't as good for you because of [Unwinding Clock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unwinding Clock).  
  
[Relic Barrier](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Relic Barrier) does exactly what you want it to do, as long as you don't mind a lack of other uses.  
  
[Icy Manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Icy Manipulator) is probably the best choice, but only if you have mana ramping, not a lot of other players, or use artifact lands.  
  
EDIT @Artscrafter I know that, but the reason why its not as good for this deck is because untapping things with the effect is much less useful with [Unwinding Clock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unwinding Clock) then it would be in a deck without it.
posts.html:
@ Fenizrael

Clock of Omens would be my choice, but probably isn't as good for you because of Unwinding Clock.

Relic Barrier does exactly what you want it to do, as long as you don't mind a lack of other uses.

Icy Manipulator is probably the best choice, but only if you have mana ramping, not a lot of other players, or use artifact lands.

EDIT @Artscrafter I know that, but the reason why its not as good for this deck is because untapping things with the effect is much less useful with Unwinding Clock then it would be in a deck without it.

posts.post_content:
I used to hate this card.   
Then I started running [Spiteful Visions](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spiteful Visions) and [Storm Seeker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Storm Seeker)s (yeah, I know!).   
I like it much more now.   
In fact, I have been put on the ropes by someone who had a howling mine out, and they died the turn they were going to crush me because without a howling mine, they would have been at 1 life.

Posted By: TheMetaRidley (5/10/2013 5:14:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Politically, this is one of the best cards in the game. The neat thing in multiplayer is, if you play this card, you've likely built a deck which is helped quite a bit by it, or needs the draw power from artifacts (W/R control comes to mind), so much so that the cards your opponent('s) draw are irrelevant to some degree. In multiplayer, most people see this played and stop attacking the guy with Howling Mine. While that's cool, it can be a pretty bad decision if that deck is a combo deck searching for it's last combo piece to win, ect.  
  
Still, a fun card and if nothing else will make a game interesting.
posts.html:

The neat thing in multiplayer is, if you play this card, you've likely built a deck which is helped quite a bit by it, or needs the draw power from artifacts (W/R control comes to mind), so much so that the cards your opponent('s) draw are irrelevant to some degree. In multiplayer, most people see this played and stop attacking the guy with Howling Mine. While that's cool, it can be a pretty bad decision if that deck is a combo deck searching for it's last combo piece to win, ect.

Still, a fun card and if nothing else will make a game interesting.
